availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Wesley Barker (Clark County, Indiana, blacksmith and city watchman, agent)

body.p: Clark County, Indiana, blacksmith, city watchman, and agent. Indiana native. Son of Noble Barker and Margaret Barker. Married to Anna M. Cash Barker. Father of Sarah Barker, John W. Barker, and Anna Barker. Blacksmith in Clark County, Indiana, in 1850. City watchman in Jeffersonville in 1860. Agent for the State of Indiana in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Jeffersonville, p. 161A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, p. 400.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Jeffersonville, Ward 5, p.500A.
Find A Grave, "John Wesley Barker (1832-1908)," Memorial #10179146, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10179146 (accessed June 4, 2021).
